title: Share: Design Blogs
content:
I'm finally getting into listening to blogs. Truth is, people talking can be whitenoise and usually doesn't disrupt my work. However, I've had a difficult time listening to design blogs, blogs that have information that I'd like to at least kind of absorb. I've finally given in and am finding a way to sort of do it.

These guys are funny and irreverent. Be A Design Cast: [#10 Typography Island](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.beadesigngroup.com/blog/archives/2006/03/be_a_design_cast_10_typography.html)
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content:
Also.

Design Matters  
Speak Up: Design Diablog

Hi Tiffany, here's a few more.

[Design Observer](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.designobserver.com/)  
 [Design Your Life](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.design-your-life.org/index.php)  
 [Advertising/Design Goodness](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.frederiksamuel.com/blog/)<cite>, this one is a photoblog, totally guilt-free!</cite>

You're right, they can be difficult to listen/read to, especially Design Observer, difficult to absorb/digest without deep, dedicated reading and thought so I don't really have time to read them often. Somehow I seem to have time to lurk around the Type ID board here... :^)

While we're listing:  
 [http://www.alistapart.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.alistapart.com/ "http://www.alistapart.com/")

Just keep my site off of your list of good blogs... I've yet to say anything of meaning or importance there yet, and would suprise myself if I did.

well lessee...

[Coudal Partners](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.coudal.com/)  
 [Authentic Boredom](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.cameronmoll.com/) by Cameron Moll

and, of course,

[Typographica](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020172809/http:/www.typographi.com/)
